name: Clinton St. Baking Company
address: 4 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA

reviews.text: The chicken sandwich is the best
Just excellent

This place is great, but that means it is popular. The breakfast is delicious and the service is excellent. Thus, you will have to wait a while to be seated. So plan ahead and get your name on the list and then go do something else close by for a short while so you don't end up waiting outside for such a long time.
Es delicioso los pancakes de berries son muy ricos y sueaves y las malteadas tambien, enormes y delicoso
Did take out. Underwhelming. Pancakes were bland and not worth the hype
The food at this restaurant is worth the wait if you decide to show up without a reservation. I've tried just about every item on the menu, you cant go wrong with this spot.
Fabulous brunch, amazing service. Get the blueberry pancakes! Make sure you make a reservation.
Great coffee and delicious blueberry pancakes. The chicken and waffles were tasty, though the waffles could have been crispier. The place gets busy, so itâ€™s best to make a reservation in advance.

The food is good. Everything was tasty and well prepared.
Wait time to get served is about 30-40mins + waiting time outside during rush hour.
Our waiter was insufferable. You could feel he was fishing for tips.
When the time to pay came we wanted to use the â€œcustom amountâ€ for tipping in the machine an he argued that it doesnâ€™t work and didnâ€™t allow us to use it and said it is 20% minimum with his phony voice. Too much attitude.

Wonderful brunch in a cool neighborhood in NYC. Loved the big windows. Hope they can expand somehow. Everything we got was delicious, though they are light on the salt. Didnâ€™t mind! We started with coffee and a hot buttered rum. Our mains were Spanish scramble with biscuit, Clinton St omelette with biscuit, and blueberry pancakes. Iâ€™ll admit I have a sweet tooth but the buttered rum and pancakes were the stars of an already delicious show. Weâ€™ve already made a reservation for our next visit.

Well this place was crowded.  No seats and long wait without reservation.  A little costly for breakfast food.  I tried the Blueberry pancakes and I must say I have had better for less the cost.  Maybe I would have had a better experience dining in.  Can't say ill be back anytime soon.  Sorry guys.
Food is good but you need to wait for a table. Service is very slow.
I keep coming back with different people who like pancakes as a party trick. They are so good.
SolÃ­s

Je viens dÃ©jeuner ici Ã  chaque passage Ã  Nyc. Il y a de l'attente si on ne rÃ©serve pas. Nous avons attendus 20min. Mais Ã§a valait le coup car leur pancakes sont incroyablement dÃ©licieux trÃ¨s moelleux il y avait des myrtilles et du caramel beurre salÃ©.  J'ai Ã©galement pris un side du poulet frits Ã  9$ et woah il Ã©tait trop bon croustillant Ã  l'extÃ©rieur et moelleux dedans. En plus j'ai eu 3 gros morceaux pour ce prix pas cher. Et nous avons Ã©galement pris une omelette au saumon qui Ã©tait excellente. Je ne peux que recommander cet endroit
endroit
Food is underwhelming to say the least, eggs were overcooked, not sure what the hype is all about wonâ€™t be coming back
One of my favorite places to have brunch/ breakfast every time I'm back home. My husband & now my kiddos love it too!

Heard good things about this place and tried to stop by for breakfast / brunch, but could not get a table and was informed that we would have to wait for a half hour. We opted for another place, but came back another day for dinner.
It was busy but we got a table.
The first waiter was fantastic. He was happy, friendly, attentive and helpful- well above the usual service norms.
after receiving our order and getting us our drinks, he apologized and informed us that his shift was finished and we will be waited on by another waiter. We thanked him and wished him a wonderful evening.
Unfortunately, the next waiter was a disaster. She was abscent and barely acknowledged us - more concerned looking at her phone while talking to another employee.
The food was good. The atmosphere was a lively Diner experience, but the second waiter(ess) ruined the dining experience.
One of the few times I didn't leave a tip.
(I debated with myself if I should of given at least 2 stars for Service - maybe 3 considering how good the first waiter was - but I just bring myself to give more than 1 after the experience with the second waiter(ess) - sorry.

Ever since this diner has gone viral it has gone from a 9 to a 3. The bacon was mushy,  how is that possible? The eggs had no seasoning, blah! And the pancakes taste like air, I could have made myself. If more customers decreases the quality dont sit so many people. Waste of $55 dollars!

First of all, I donâ€™t know why this place even went viral, the pancakes are no good, no consistency in them, its like trying to cut a hot cake that falls apart into crumbles, coffee tasted meh, the orange juice was good tho, but too small, they wanted to push our reservation because the place was busy and the service is almost acceptable. NOT worth it
Amazing experience must visit if you are in town
People come for the pancakes which are really good but the savory breakfast items were the star! Best scrambled eggs Iâ€™ve had in a long time. Fast yet polite service and very cute atmosphere.

Hands down one of the best brunch places in NY! We been coming here for years and is always consistent! The food is delicious with great quality and the cappuccino always on point! Our favorites are the Blueberry Pancakes (super fluffy), Chicken and Waffles (crispy) and the Special Waffle with the seasonal fruit (fresh). The Maple Butter is a perfect combination! Plenty of indoor seating. Service is always excellent and efficient! Staff always friendly! Also, make a reservation it gets really busy specially on the weekends. Highly recommend it!

I came for the pancakes, which was fine, honestly, nothing special even with their butter maple syrup (normal maple syrup tastes better)

Service was amazing

Wow, such a disappointment.
Booked for my husbandâ€™s 50th birthday and it was a terrible experience.
We were rushed through our sitting even though we were ten minutes early.
No gluten free bread or light milk and the coffee was undrinkable.
Do not waste your time or money.
Great food best place ever

If you are in NYC and can get a reservation or go in to the afternoon, it is definitely worth the time. I am still buzzing from my first bites at this NYC establishment.  The crew works together like a well oiled machine. The star? The pancakes! We had yummy plain for the purist at the table and blueberry and chocolate chunk. Each dish hot and fluffy. I also recommended a side order of the hash browns which had an unbelievable crispy outside and moist inside.  I will be back for these stacks.

Clinton Street Co. has become a family favorite! The waffle and chicken is to die for. The chicken is always crispy and cooked to perfection. The flavoring is the same when you sit down and when you take out. The blueberry pancakes are my husbandâ€™s favorite pancakes in the city. The service is wonderful! We once went with our 2mo and we got a free muffin as a congratulations on her birth. Itâ€™s a great spot for breakfast and we continue to go back time and time again!
Pancakes are all you read and hear about. Are amazing. Is a great option for brunch but make sure you reserve because it gets absolutely packed

I went for breakfast and ordered the famous blueberry pancakes with a side of bacon. The pancakes were delicious â€” light, fluffy, and perfectly cooked. The warm maple butter they serve on top is out of this world and really makes the whole dish stand out. You can tell why these pancakes have the reputation they do.

The side of bacon was great too, crispy and flavorful, and paired perfectly with the sweetness of the pancakes. The coffee was good and the service was friendly even though the place was packed.

There was a huge line when I arrived in the morning, so definitely make a reservation if you can or go early. Itâ€™s one of those NYC breakfast spots that truly lives up to the hype.
Takeout was pretty quick on Sunday morning. The pancakes were ok. The syrup was good
Excelentes pancakes!

The food is typical diner/brunch. The pancakes were a slight disappointment because they were hyped so much. The pancakes were extra thick and the maple butter tasted like butterscotch. Not what I was expecting for a pancake dish. We also ordered sides of hashbrowns, bacon, and eggs. Hashbrowns were more like crispy home fries. The bacon was ehh so definitely ask for the bacon to be crispy.

The drinks though were amazing. Orange juice tasted so fresh and the cocktails others were ordering looked delicious.

We were a walk-in and were added to the wait list around 10am on a rainy Saturday. We waited 80-90 mins across the street.

DÃ©licieux et copieux comme on s'y attend!
Je recommande
Made reservations in Sept for breakfast on a weekday. Biscuits had great flavor and texture. Visited from CA and will definitely go back whenever weâ€™re back in NY.

If thereâ€™s one NYC spot that truly lives up to its breakfast reputation, itâ€™s Clinton St. Baking Company. I finally tried their famous pancakes this weekend, and let me tell you.. they deserve every bit of the hype. Fluffy, lil crispy on outside, and served with their homemade maple butter sauce thatâ€™s honestly addictive.. itâ€™s what makes this dish so uniquely delicious.

We also ordered the raspberry yogurt cupcake (light, tangy, and perfectly balanced) and their fried chicken, which was crisped to perfection with a beautiful honey dressing and some hot sauce that tied everything together. Every bite felt like comfort food done right. Simple ingredients, but executed flawlessly.

The best part? Despite it being a weekend morning, I didnâ€™t have to wait in the infamous line (which can get really long). I booked ahead on Resy, and it made the experience seamless, definitely recommend doing that if youâ€™re planning a visit.

Bottom line: come hungry, book ahead, and donâ€™t skip the pancakes. They might just be the best in NYC

Love this place so much. Went here three times in year 2022. Best pancake spot in MANHATTAN. Best time to go is cold weather since the food is already cozy and comfortable. Awesome manager too. Canâ€™t wait to go next time here

Update 2025
Service. Food. Atmosphere. Everything is amazing. Shout out to Shannon for having great hospitality and great memory of the customers! Shout out to waitress at the bar for making our visit welcoming. Love coming back here every time!
Best breakfast ever!
Love the food. The latkas are delicious the pancakes are delicious everything was perfect.

Pancakes spaziali!
Porzione enorme, l'abbiamo divisa in 2 per colazione.
Se seduti al banco refill di acqua e caffÃ¨ continuo!

Uneven. Sometimes food is great, other times itâ€™s missing main components and dry and unflavorful. Must be something to do with whoâ€™s on shift in the kitchen. A shame, since when itâ€™s good it can be very good.
Plain pancakes deserve 4.9 stars. The sauce is the key. Not quite as good as Golden Diner
Fuimos al local de times out market comimos los pancakes con blueberries  , nos parecieron normales y sobrevalorados, ademÃ¡s de caros 18 usd

Lovely experience! Service was excellent. Food tasted great and fresh. We paid $54.44 for two drinks (tea and orange juice) and two breakfast plates. The only â€negativeâ€œ point is that itâ€™s a bit cold inside so bring a jacket with you. And I would recommend to make a reservation to avoid waiting times.
The Freshly squeeze orange juice is delicious!!! I very much enjoyed the chicken sandwich. Packed house which is GREAT to see but ticket time for customer service was not the greatest :)

Thoroughly enjoyed myself here. Came here alone and ordered the Blueberry Pancakes and the Spiked Cider cold. The Pancakes were absolutely divine!! Fluffy in the middle and crispy on the rim of it just perfection. The Caramel Maple Syrup complimented it very well and the only disappointing part was when it ended! Will be visiting again to try the chicken and waffles! If you love pancakes and order baked goods checked this place out! Make a reservation if youâ€™re with a partner as it gets packed!
We bought 4 different types of muffins. We didn't wait for lunch to enjoy them. There was a line to purchase their bakery items.

This place is an absolute gem for brunch lovers! I tried the Wild Maine Blueberry Pancakes with Warm Maple Butter, Latke Eggs Benedict, Fried Chicken & Waffles, Espresso Martini, Habanero Margarita of the Day, and Key Lime Meringue Pie, and everything was delicious!

My absolute favorite? The blueberry pancakes, hands down the best pancakes Iâ€™ve ever had! Fluffy, warm, and bursting with flavor. The chicken & waffles were a close second, crispy, savory, and perfectly paired. The drinks were just as impressive, especially the espresso martini.

The vibe here is chic, classic, and inviting, perfect for a girlsâ€™ brunch, a date, or just treating yourself. Iâ€™m already looking forward to my next visit. Highly recommend!!!

My visit to Clinton St. Baking Company was an experience that certainly lived up to its reputation, though with a few caveats. Getting a reservation, especially on a weekend, felt like a quest, so I opted for a weekday evening. The atmosphere was bustling and lively, definitely on the noisier side, which meant it wasn't the spot for a quiet, lingering conversation, but it had a charming, classic diner vibe.

The service was consistently excellent; the staff were attentive and efficient despite the crowd. Now, for the food â€“ the pancakes are truly exceptional. Fluffy and delicious, particularly the blueberry ones with their warm maple butter, they are an absolute must-try. Their signature chicken and waffles also lived up to the hype; the chicken was huge, crispy, and paired perfectly with a fantastic hot sauce, offering great value. I was also pleasantly surprised by the salmon burger, which was incredibly tasty, and the double bacon was like delicious beef jerky.

While most dishes were fantastic, I found the truffle Brussels sprouts a tad salty, and the crispy potato pancakes weren't as crispy as I'd hoped. The seasonal drinks, like the hot buttered rum, were unique and strong. Despite the potential for long waits and the bustling environment, the quality of the food, especially the baked goods and signature dishes, makes Clinton St. Baking Company a highly recommended spot for an indulgent breakfast or brunch. Just remember to book ahead!

Clinton Street Baking Company is the perfect spot for breakfast any time of day, even dinner! My friends and I shared an amazing spread: the Brioche French Toast with caramelized bananas, Pancakes with Warm Maple Butter, Crispy Potato Pancakes, and a Fried Chicken Sandwich. Every dish was flavorful, comforting, and very filling, definitely come with an appetite. The staff were kind, patient, and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed, even with a last-minute to-go order. The space at night feels cozy and relaxed, with warm lighting and a lively atmosphere that makes it great for groups or a casual night out.

Famous for pancakesâ€”and it deserves the hype. The blueberry pancakes are incredibly fluffy with crisp edges and warm maple butter that ties everything together. The chocolate-chip stack is rich and melty without being too sweet. Portions are big (a stack of three is easy to share). Cozy NYC brunch vibe with friendly service and a chalkboard of specials. Expect a waitâ€”go early on a weekday if you can. If you love brunch, this spot is a must.

Iâ€™ve been here twice and both times have been pleasant and yummy! Came without a reservation each time and got seated within 20 minutes while in peak period so donâ€™t let the wait times deter you! The pancakes are worth every calorie!

Went here to try their pancakes. The maple butter was great. Pancakes were fluffy, flavorful, with a nice crispness. Highly recommend reservations. Not uncommon for a line for seating with the line forming 15-30 min before opening. Folks next to me ordered a sundae which looked fantastic. Hope to be back and try other items on the menu.

Heard a lot of how great this place was I finally checked it out. It has a cozy vibe to it and the food is delicious. I highly recommend the Pancakes with Warm Maple Butter with bananas.  Was also very happy with the Country Breakfast.  Be warned the place is very packed and we had to wait 50min for a table for lunch on a Tues. But is worth the wait. I can't wait to go back and try some of their other offerings. Highly recommended.
